Scythia first found out about the one called scythice, which grows round Lake Maeotis. One of its qualities is great sweetness, and it is very beneficial for the complaint called asthma. Another great merit of it is the freedom from hunger and thirst enjoyed by those who keep it in their mouths. XLIV. The same people find the same property in their hippace,‘² which has the unique quality of affecting horses in the same way. It is said that on these two plants the Scythians can fast from food and drink even for as long as twelve days at a time. XLV. Thrace found out about ischaemon, which is Ischaemon. said to stanch bleeding when a vein has not merely been cut but even severed. It creeps along the ground as does millen the leaves are rough and downy. The kind that grows in Italy, stuffed into the nostrils, and also when used as an amulet, stanches bleedingl' XLVI. The Vettones in Spain discovered the plant Vettonica. called vettonica in Gaul, serratula ⁶ in Italy, and cestros or psychrotrophon by the Greeks, a plant more highly valued than any other. It springs up with an angular stem of two cubits, spreading out from the root leaves rather like those offlapathum, ser- rated, and with a purple fruiting-head.
